column4: i don't think that would be a bug ... more like a request ? btw what kind of software you looking for ?
why not you write one ? thats how linux started ....

yes, I guess I can write one in this case, if it's simple enough. But in general, it may be hard, and there may be others who can, and who are looking for something to do... there should be a way of contacting them
perhaps its already been done ? may we know what kind of prog you are looking for ?
that's besides the point. I'm just making a general observation that there should be ways of doing this thing.
how do i put it ? yes it can be ... but people in OSS write codes because they are itchy ... frankly i thats how i see it ...
yes, but sometimes one can be itchy, and only others can scratch the itch :)
true .. if there is a demand ...
exactly. What I'm asking is: how does one demand?
slashdot is very good place ... and here too ... you can also demand by downloading the windows counterpart program many times ... if someone sees it then surely they will do the OSS version
that's very presumptuous; Windows very likely has no equivalent at all :p
then how can i put it .... it doesn't exist ?

true, there are a lot of ways I can help, but do you agree that having a "Requested functionality" source *would help* (1) users who want things done and can't write it themselves and (2) programmers looking for ideas?
All I'm saying is that such a thing would help
i know what you can do right now ... how about a wish list ?
which are the "good" graphics cards, BTW?
